name: metal platform 0
description: Setup perfusion station: Place metal platform within the glass chamber.

name: port 0
description: Attach a butterfly needle to each port.

name: tubing 0
description: Place the unclamped end of tubing in the perfusion buffer

name: perfusion machine 0
description: And turn on perfusion machine.

name: perfusion machine 1
description:
Pause the perfusion machine until ready to use. 

3.

name: anesthetized animal 0
description: Take anesthetized animal (via IP injection of Avertin)

name: abdominal skin 0
description: Remove the abdominal skin, preserving the muscle and peritoneum.

name: abdominal organs 0
description:
Open the peritoneum and open the abdominal cavity for full visualization of the liver and abdominal organs. 

5.

name: inferior vena cava (IVC) and portal vein (PV) 0
description:
Push the stomach and intestines to the right side of the animal and identify the inferior vena cava (IVC) and portal vein (PV). 

6.

name: tubing 1
description: Unclamp the butterfly needle tubing.

name: perfusion machine 1 1
description: Turn on the perfusion machine.

name: inferior vena cava (IVC) and portal vein (PV) 1
description: And cut the PV.

name: inferior vena cava (IVC) and portal vein (PV) 2
description:
At this point the animal should rapidly bleed out and perfusion buffer should begin to flow out of the PV. 

8.

name: perfusion buffer 0
description:
Pass at least 100 mL of perfusion buffer through a single mouse.

9.

name: collagenase buffer 0
description: While the perfusion is running, add the collagenase (transported on ice) to the collagenase buffer

name: tubing 2
description: And switch the tubing to the collagenase buffer.

name: collagenase buffer 1
description:
And run through entire volume of collagenase buffer.

11.

name: liver 0
description: When the perfusion is finished, remove the liver by cutting along the vasculature and connective tissue; avoid cutting the liver parenchyma.

name: liver 1
description:
Place the liver in a petri dish with 10 mL of perfusion buffer.  

12.

name: liver 2
description:
Agitate the liver to dissociate the hepatocytes. 

13.

name: dissociated cell suspension 0
description: Using a serological pipette, transfer the dissociated cell suspension to a 70 micron mesh filter over a 50 mL Falcon tube.

name: collagenase buffer 2
description:
Once filtered through, complete the volume with perfusion buffer to dilute the collagenase. 

14.

name: dissociated cell suspension 1
description:
Immediately centrifuge at a minimum speed of 800 rpm for 5 minutes. 

15.

name: supernatant 0
description: Discard the supernatant.

name: dissociated cell suspension 2
description: Resuspend in washing media

name: supernatant 1
description:
And centrifuge again at 800 rpm for 5 minutes.  

16.

name: supernatant 2
description: Discard the supernatant.

name: supernatant 3
description:
Resuspend in 10 mL (or 5 mL if the cell pellet is small) of plating media. 

17.

name: supernatant 3 1
description: Suspended in plating media, the hepatocytes will remain viable for a few hours, until plated.  Once plated, place in 37°C cell incubator.

name: collagen coated surface 0
description: Cells should be plated on a collagen coated surface.
